definitions.definition: Turning to glass or glasslike material: the action or process of vitrifying a material : conversion into an amorphous solid free of any crystalline structure by addition or removal of heat or by mixture with an additive .
The result of such conversion : a vitrified substance or object .

main_definition: ( usually uncountable ) Turning to glass or glasslike material: the action or process of vitrifying a material : conversion into an amorphous solid free of any crystalline structure by addition or removal of heat or by mixture with an additive .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) An instance of such conversion .
( countable ) The result of such conversion : a vitrified substance or object .
